definition: to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: The unemployed engineer wrote a dozen applications for jobs but go nothing.
sentences.chinese: 失業的工程師一連寫了十幾封求職信，但一無所獲。

sentences.english: Can't John at least take the trouble to write a note of thanks?
sentences.chinese: 難道約翰連寫封感謝信這最起碼的事也做不到？

sentences.english: When Dorian had finished the letter, he felt that he had been forgiven.
sentences.chinese: 當道連寫完這封信後，他感覺自己已經被原諒了。

sentences.english: He writes mostly with linked strokes, that I can hardly distinguish.
sentences.chinese: 連寫的很多，我都不大認得出來。

sentences.english: Link writing for Chinese words has the necessity.
sentences.chinese: 實行中文分詞連寫確實具有必要性。

sentences.english: The paper has been written word-segmentedly.
I wrote four hours a day for ten years before I was published.
sentences.chinese: 我每天寫作四小時，一連寫了十年之後，才發表作品。

sentences.english: The coach gave his team a chalk talk before the game.
sentences.chinese: 教練在比賽前給隊員們連寫帶畫地講解了一番。
